alert.note: Alert for Central and Eastern Lake County (Oregon) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Medford (Southwest Oregon and Northern California)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 09 at 5:14PM PDT by NWS Medford
info.description: ...A line of strong thunderstorms will impact portions of southeastern Lake County through 600 PM PDT... At 513 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms near Warner Valley Scenic Overlook, or 40 miles northeast of Lakeview, moving east to northeast at 40 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Warner Valley Scenic Overlook, Warner Wetlands and Doherty Slide Hang-Gliding Launch. This includes Warner Highway 140 in Oregon between mile markers 41 and 62. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
